section.name: Sanity4J plugin installation in eclipse 3.4
section.p: This document describes the steps necessary to install and run the QA plug-in in the eclispe 3.4 / RSA 7.5 IDE.
1) Launch the IDE and select "Help-->Software Updates" from the menu bar
4) Select the Sanity4J Eclipse plugin folder from wherever you downloaded and extracted the plugin to.
7) Accept the licence agreement and click "Finish".
9) Before the plugin can be used, some PC-specific configuration parameters must be set. Select "Window-->Preferences" from the menu bar.
10) Select "Sanity4J Preferences from the left-hand tree view". Select "Browse" for the products directory.

11) Select the location of the directory which contains the tools necessary for Sanity4J to function, currently findbugs-1.3.3, pmd-4.2.2, checkstyle-4.4 and cobertura-1.9. Refer to the user guide for the latest versions.

12) On returning to the Sanity4J Preferences screen, select "Browse" for the Java 1.5 executable, which is required to run some of the tools. Select the appropriate runtime executable, for example "java.exe" on a windows platform.
14) After installing the plug-in, a new "QA" icon should be visible on the tool bar in the Java view. Open up one of your Java files and click the QA button.
15) A progress dialog should open up while the analysis is being performed.
16) After the analysis is complete, the standard Sanity4J report should open in a new view part. This view can be docked or made into a separate window.
